course.title: iOS 9 and Swift 2: From Beginner to Paid Professionalâ„¢
course.subtitle: The BEST online iOS 9 Swift 2 course online. Lets learn iOS 9 & Swift 2

reviews.body:
Hands down the best course i've taken part in to date. The content Mark has put together is not only useful for a future career in iOS development but the way in which Mark is able to explain complicated situations to someone who has no idea about this field is the best part. Making complex scenarios so easy to understand is a skill Mark has mastered. I haven't completed the course yet and have already signed up for more.

Highly recommended

I've learned a great deal more from this course vs other iOS 9 & Swift courses. As with anything you need to put in the time and effort. Mark is an excellent teacher, very engaging and helpful. If you're committed to learn iOS & Swift, this course is a must buy!

I have tried a few other iOS Development courses, but truthfully, they don't come anywhere close to good as this one. Mark is a very experienced developer, and a great teacher as well. This course will not only teach you all of the technical know how that you need to know, but it will also teach you how to design apps to make them more attractive to users. From all that I have learned so far, it is safe to say that this course will give you a great start in an iOS Development career either working for yourself, an already established company, or whatever you choose to do with the knowledge learned in this course.
Practical no-nonsense instruction, yet fun and non-scripted. As real as it gets!

I really think Mark Price nails it, with an happy and exiting attitude, creating various apps, to really give some useful examples.

You will go, as a beginner, easily into this course - of course with different pace depending on who You are.

I'm happy I found this course.

The best course that is taken, Mark is a very good teacher and easy to understand..

Thanks Mark..
Entertaining lecture, learning tons of stuff from him. although you need to constantly pause the videos to look up stuff as he doesn't explain everything exactly.
Mark knows how to teach you iOS and Swift programming as it would be used in real-world scenarios, and makes it fun to learn how! My favorite course I've ever taken on Udemy!

I actually found Mark's course after frustration with, frankly the sheer ugliness of the UI elements used in another iOS course. Also there was a complete lack of modularity/design patterns/best practices in the other course.

By contrast, Mark pays special attention to the user interface/design/typography but NOT at a sacrifice to teaching you to create compelling apps with efficient, robust code underneath. In app after app, all building on each other in a very clear gradient of expanding scope/difficulty, both UI and code are explained in detail and with clarity. Mark's enthusiasm is infectious, there were times, even though I love Swift/iOS dev, I was just feeling a bit overwhelmed, and within 5 minutes of feeling the enthusiasm and excitement from Mark, I was back in the zone. Mark also covers, (and heretofore, mysterious to me), essentials, such as UIStackview, terminal, Git, GitHub, Cocoapods, third party frameworks such as Alamofire and Firebase all with just the right amount of depth to extract the essence of what you need to know but always a keen focus on the practical.

He has an *invaluable* section on career prep, and it's a refreshingly NO-BS, candid, and motivational discussion on the topic. He also walks you through what appears to be the rather byzantine (painful?) process of submitting your app to the app store, and doesn't just glaze over stuff. He realizes that even things that can appear simple when they're explained can be much more complicated when you're actually alone and doing by yourself.

Each app project Mark walks you through from start to finish, with no editing. You see him choose assets, install 3rd party tools, fuss around with autolayout, debug when necessary. Therefore you see the *process* itself which can involve trial and error and that there is no illusion that the creative/dev process is some tidy straight line.

Did I mention there is a section on Photoshop (again dev essentials focused) as well? Mark also continues to add new content to the course based directly on feedback he receives from his students.

My only critique, would be that a side lesson on Swift closures/(blocks) would be of great benefit if one were added. This is such a key area to understand in the later apps, and a sidebar lesson, especially explained in Mark's unique style would be fantastic towards shoring up a concept that is often confusing. It would also be cool to have a section on freelancing in the career dev area. However in the sum total of the course, those are minor concerns and are more than overshadowed by the quality of the course as a whole.

Mark teaches from the perspective of what's practical with a clear goal on making you self-sufficient, and not relying on a designer, or leaving you scratching your head as to WHY he chose a certain layout, or a certain approach to the code. At the same time, you'll be having a LOT of fun along the way. I really can't say enough positive things about this course. My thanks to Mark Price for creating it.

Great course. I do have some points of critic. Sometimes in the course some parts are going really fast. I was confused with the required, convenience initializers in first place but I figured out with some help on devslopes. All in all this course is great, really great. Valuable and solid information is provided by mark and I think if you really want to master ios this course can help you reallly good with it. I say gogoogogog mark and I am looking forward for the advanced ios course. Thank you so much <3

Updated:

This course was amazing and I already did some other courses of mark too. iOS 10 is the course I am taking right now and currently I am developing my new app called: ActiveRest. It uses algorithm and gives the user smarts tips in powerlifting. Mark stay tuned to review this amazing app! :D

A great course and a wonderful teacher. Thanks Mark Sir. It's been a wonderful experience learning from you. I just wanted to know more about basics of Swift and Objective C and how to read OBJC apis so I encountered small issues while building my own app. Apart from that everything is wonderful.

instructor.name: Mark Wahlbeck
instructor.briefIntroduction:
I am a veteran mobile developer having built over 57 mobile apps for iOS and Android, and I've also build multiple Unity 3D games, including Call of Duty Ghosts mobile. 

I also spend most of my days now as a professional engineering instructor  - changing the lives of students throughout the world - helping them make amazing salaries as engineers.

My passion is helping people reveal hidden talents and guide them into the world of startups and programming. I currently am teaching iOS 10, Apple TV & tvOS, React & Flux web development, Objective-C, Swift 3, Android, Javascript, Node, and Java. I also teach Unity 3D game development.
